API Reference version v2

https://api.pubpub.org

Introduction

This API provides access to the PubPub database. All requests and responses are in the form of application/json. Requests should be made to the following URL paths added to the hostname https://api-v2-dev.pubpub.org. For example https://api-v2-dev.pubpub.org/user?username=test1. This API and the data it uses are currently accessible through the dev frontend at https://v3-dev.pubpub.org.

Authentication

Access to secured URLs is granted by one of two methods:

  1. A session cookie in the request headers
  2. Basic Auth

The cookie method is used when interacting with the database through a (often proxied) frontend. For API requests made from scripts or bots, it is best to use Basic Auth. To test basic auth, simple URL encoding is sufficient, e.g. https://[username]:[accessToken]@api-v2-dev.pubpub.org/user?username=test1

The accessToken for each user can be found on the settings page their profile (https://v3-dev.pubpub.org/user/test1/profile).

For most secured routes, authentication is optional. If authenticated, private data will be returned, but if not, any publicly available data is sent. For example, the public query for a user will return their name, image, and basic profile contents. An authenticated query for a user will return that user's email and other secured fields.

Contributing

This API documentation and the associated server code is all open source: https://github.com/pubpub/pubpub-api. Contributions, fixes, bug reports are welcome!

Bugs, typos, or inconsistencies can be reported on our repo (go to Github Issues).

Example - Adding a Pub

A common use case is to programatically add pubs to PubPub. This can be achieved in a few simple steps.

1. Create a pub

The first step is to create a pub. A Pub can be thought of as a bucket for all of the content you wish to eventually publish. Discussions, contributors, versions, and publication status are all 'owned' by the Pub. You must be authenticated (go to docs) in order to create pubs.

To create a pub, send a POST request to /pub (go to docs). If succesful, this will return the newly created Pub object. It is suggested you hang onto the value of pub.id as you will need it when uploading content such as files and versions to the pub.

POST request sample body to /pub

{
  description: "Lallala"
  avatar: "https://assets.pubpub.org/_site/pub.png"
  slug: "happyurl"
  title:"My Pub Title"
}

2. Create a version

All content within a pub is versioned. To achieve this, a pub has a series of 'versions'. Each version is a unique list of file ids. New files replace old file ids, and a new version is created. In this way, all (versions of) files are maintained and a pub accesses them through the the version wrapper.

To create a version, send a POST request to pub/versions (go to docs). In this version, an array of File objects must be included. If the file URL is not a pubpub URL, the file will be uploaded to pubpub so that they can be properly archived.

POST request sample body to /pub/versions

{
  pubId: 114, 
  versionMessage: "This is a new version", 
  isPublished: false, 
  files: [
    {
      name: "main.md",
      type: "text/markdown",
      url: "https://assets.pubpub.org/_testing/1483708995904.md",
      originalDate: "2008-01-06T16:44:36.128Z"
    },
    {
      name: "diffusionAnalysis.png",
      type: "image/png",
      url: "https://assets.pubpub.org/_testing/1483708995895.png"
      originalDate: "2017-01-04T12:24:36.826Z"
    }
  ]
}

3. Add Contributors

When a pub is created, the authenticated user who created the pub is set by default to be an author. If the pub has additional contributors, they can be added using the API. Submit a POST request to pub/contributors (go to docs). If you're unsure of a user's id, you can search for users by name and username using the search/users endpoint (go to docs)

POST request sample body to /pub/contributors

{
  pubId: 114,
  userId: 6
}

By default, this use is added as a contributor with no read or edit permissions, and is not listed as an author. To update these parameters, send a PUT request to

PUT request to set permissions to pub/contributors (go to docs). The contributorId is the id of the object returned by the previous POST to /pub/contributors

PUT request sample body to /pub/contributors

  {
    canEdit: true,
    canRead: false,
    contributorId: 146,
    isAuthor: true,
    isHidden: false,
    pubId: 114
  }

4. Publish a version

New versions are private by default. If a pub has no public versions, it too is private. To publish a version (and thus make the pub publicly available), send a PUT request to /pub/versions (go to docs).

PUT request sample body to /pub/versions

{
  isPublished: true,
  pubId: 114,
  versionId: 93
}

Activities

Routes to access date about Activities

/activities

get

If not logged in, get a list of global activities. If logged in, will return following activities as well as global activities. Optionally, will include assets of user (pubs and journals), for building a landing page.

  • Request
  • Response

Query Parameters

  • range: (string)

    date or count of activities to grab. Allows pagination. [Not yet implemented]

  • assets: (boolean)

    Whether to include user pubs and journals

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  activities: {
    pubs: [],
    journals: [],
    users: [],
    labels: [],
    myPubs: [],
    myJournals: [],
    myUser: []
  }
  assets: {
    pubs: [],
    journals: [],
  },
}

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

Activities not found

Follows

Routes to manage Follow objects

/follows/journal

Routes to access data about a Journal's followers

get

Get a list of all followers

  • Request
  • Response

Query Parameters

  • journalId: required (number)

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

[
  {
      "id": 1,
      "username": "jane-doe",
      "firstName": "Jane",
      "lastName": "Doe",
      "avatar": "http://images.com/example.jpg"
  }
]

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

Journal not found
post

Create a new Follow

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • journalId: required (number)

    id of the journal that will be followed.

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  "followerId": 1,
  "journalId": 3,
  "updatedAt": "2016-11-22T02:10:21.874Z",
  "createdAt": "2016-11-22T02:10:21.874Z"
}

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "Error following journal"
}
delete

Remove a follow

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • journalId: required (number)

    id of the journal to remove follow from

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

true

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "Error deleting follow"
}

Journal

Routes to access data about Journals

/journal

get
  • Request
  • Response

Query Parameters

  • slug: required (string)

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

true
post

Create a new Journal

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • title: required (string)

    title used for the new journal

  • slug: required (string)

    slug used for the journal url

  • short description: required (string)

    short description used for the new journal

  • about: (string)

    long description to be used for the new journal

  • logo: (string)

    Large log for the new journal. Can be used in the header of the journal's page

  • avatar: (string)

    square avatar for the new journal. Used on preview cards

  • website: (string)

    website url

  • twitter: (string)

    twitter account

  • facebook: (string)

    facebook account

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
    "id": 15,
    "slug": "my-journal",
    "title": "My Journal",
}

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "Error creating journal"
}
put

Used to allow a journal admin to update the journal.

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • journalId: required (string)

    id of the journal to be changed

  • slug: (string)

    new slug

  • title: (string)

    new title

  • description: (string)

    new description

  • about: (string)

    new about

  • logo: (string)

    new logo

  • avatar: (string)

    new avatar

  • website: (string)

    new website

  • twitter: (string)

    new twitter

  • facebook: (string)

    new facebook

  • headerColor: (string)

    new headerColor

  • headerMode: (string)

    new headerMode

  • headerAlign: (string)

    new headerAlign

  • headerImage: (string)

    new headerImage

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

true

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "Error updating journal"
}
delete

Delete the journal

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • journal: (string)

    id of the journal to be deleted

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

Journal set inactive

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "Error deleting journal"
}

/journal/label

Routes to access data about the labels (collections) owned by a journal, and to apply them to pubs.

post

Create a PubLabel. The relation between a pub and a label

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • pubId: required (string)

    id of the pub the label is being applied to

  • labelId: required (string)

    id of the label to be applied

  • journalId: required (string)

    id of the journal owning the label

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
    "id": 15,
}

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "Error creating PubLabel for this journal"
}
delete

Delete the label relationship

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • pubId: required (string)

    id of the pub the label is being applied to

  • labelId: required (string)

    id of the label to be applied

  • journalId: required (string)

    id of the journal owning the label

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

Pub set inactive

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "Error deleting pub"
}

  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters

    id of the user to be added

  • journalId: required (string)

    id of the journal this admin is being added to

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  "id": 5,
  "createdAt": "2016-11-21T21:08:06.824Z",
  "updatedAt": "2016-11-21T21:08:06.824Z",
  "userId": 2,
  "journalId": 1,
  "user": {
    "id": 2,
    "username": "test-account",
    "firstName": "Test",
    "lastName": "Account",
    "avatar": "http://image.com/example.jpg"
  }
}

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "Error creating new contributor"
}
delete

Delete a journal admin

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • journalId: required (string)

    journal which owns the given admin to be removed

  • journalAdminId: required (string)

    id of the journalAdmin to be removed

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

true

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "Error deleting admin"
}

/journal/submit

Routes to access data about a journal's submitted pubs

get

Get submitted pubs

  • Request
  • Response

Query Parameters

  • journalId: required (string)

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
    id: 9,
}

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

Journal not found
put

Change the isRejected value of a pubSubmit

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • pubId: required (string)

    id of the pub to be updated

  • journalId: required (string)

    id of the journal

  • isRejected: (string)

    BOOLEAN dictating whether the submission has been rejected

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
    "id": 15,
}

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "Error creating pub"
}

Labels

Routes to access data about labels

/labels

get

Get a single global label and associated pubs.

  • Request
  • Response

Query Parameters

  • title: required (string)

    title of the label

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

[
  {
      "id": 1,
      "title": "Biology",
      "color": null
  },
  {
      "id": 2,
      "title": "Physics",
      "color": "#335529"
  }
]

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

Label not found
post

Create a Label. Currently, labels can only be created if associated with a journal, user, of pub.

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • userId: (string)

    id of the user the label is owned by

  • pubId: (string)

    id of the pub the label is owned by

  • journalId: (string)

    id of the pub the label is owned by

  • title: required (string)

    title of the label

  • color: (string)

    color of the label

  • description: (string)

    Text explaining the purpose of the label

  • isDisplayed: (boolean)

    Boolean setting whether the rendered is displayd in certain contexts (e.g. Journal header)

  • order: (number)

    Number of double precision used for order some labels (e.g. Journal collections)

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  id: 5,
  userId: 4,
  title: "My Physics Label",
  color: "#ff0000",
  isDisplayed: true,
  description: "A collection of physics articles",
  updatedAt: "2016-11-30T21:50:45.124Z",
  createdAt: "2016-11-30T21:50:45.124Z",
  journalId: null,
  pubId: null
}

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "Error creating label"
}
put

Update a Label. Currently, labels can only be updated if associated with a journal, user, of pub.

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • userId: (number)

    id of the user the label is owned by

  • pubId: (number)

    id of the pub the label is owned by

  • journalId: (number)

    id of the pub the label is owned by

  • labelId: required (number)

    id of the label to be updated

  • title: (string)

    title of the updated label

  • color: (string)

    color of the updated label

  • order: (number)

    Number of double precision used for order some labels (e.g. Journal collections)

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
    "id": 15,
}

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "Error creating pub"
}
delete

Delete the label

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • userId: (string)

    id of the user the label is owned by

  • pubId: (string)

    id of the pub the label is owned by

  • journalId: (string)

    id of the pub the label is owned by

  • labelId: required (string)

    id of the pub the label is being applied to

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

true

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "Error deleting pub"
}

Licenses

Routes to access licenses available on PubPub

/licenses

get

Return array of all licenses, or, if licenseId is provided, return an array with a single specific license

  • Request
  • Response

Query Parameters

  • licenseId: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

[
  {
  "id": 1,
  "title": "CC BY 3.0 US",
  "description": "Share  copy and redistribute the material in any medium or format\nAdapt  remix, transform, and build upon the material\nfor any purpose, even commercially.\nThe licensor cannot revoke these freedoms as long as you follow the license terms.",
  "url": "https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/us/",
  "avatar": "https://creativecommons.org/images/deed/by.png"
  }
]

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

No Licenses found

Login

Used to login a user

/login

get

Gets the associated signup data for a given hash. Most importantly, returns the email that was signed up with.

  • Request
  • Response

Query Parameters

  • hash: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  username: "jane"
  firstName: "Jane"
  lastName: "Sanchez"
  avatar: "https://avatars.com/1234"
  email: "jane@email.com"
  bio: "I am a biologist."
  publicEmail: "jane@public.com"
  github: "https://github.com/jane"
  orcid: "123-412-1234-123"
  twitter: "@jane"
  website: "https://www.jane.com"
  googleScholar: "janejane"
}

HTTP status code 401

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

Unauthorized
post

Creates a signup hash for a given email address. If the email has already been used (and account creation has not been completed), it will increment the count. On creation or increment, a signup email is sent.

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • email: required (string)

    email of the account to login

  • password: required (string)

    password of the account to login

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  username: "jane"
  firstName: "Jane"
  lastName: "Sanchez"
  avatar: "https://avatars.com/1234"
  email: "jane@email.com"
  bio: "I am a biologist."
  publicEmail: "jane@public.com"
  github: "https://github.com/jane"
  orcid: "123-412-1234-123"
  twitter: "@jane"
  website: "https://www.jane.com"
  googleScholar: "janejane"
}

HTTP status code 401

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

Unauthorized

Logout

Used to logout the user associated with cookies

/logout

get

Logout the given user based on their cookie

  • Response

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

true

Pub

Routes to access data about Pubs

/pub

get

Get pub data. Includes connected user, discussion, label, etc data. If the user's cookie or token is included, private data (private discussions, versions, etc) are included.

  • Request
  • Response

Query Parameters

  • slug: required (string)

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  id: 102,
  slug: "my-doc-url",
  title: "Analysis of Spectral Filters",
  description: "This document compares 45 spectral filters.",
  avatar: "https://assets.pubpub.org/_testing/1483555461063.jpg",
  isClosed: null,
  hideAuthorsList: null,
  customAuthorList: null,
  distinguishedClone: null,
  inactive: null,
  isPublished: true,
  threadNumber: null,
  createdAt: "2017-01-04T18:44:23.506Z",
  updatedAt: "2017-01-06T15:53:34.908Z",
  replyRootPubId: null,
  replyParentPubId: null,
  licenseId: null,
  defaultContext: null,
  cloneParentPubId: null,
  contributors: [...],
  followers: [...],
  versions: [...],
  labels: [...],
  pubLabels: [...],
  pubSubmits: [...],
  clones: [...],
  invitedReviewers: [...],
  license: null,
  cloneParent: null,
  pubFeatures: [...],
  discussions: [...],
  canEdit: false,
  allReactions: [...]
}

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

Pub not found
post

Create a new Pub

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • slug: required (string)

    slug used for the pub url

  • title: required (string)

    title used for the new pub

  • avatar: required (string)

    preview image to be used for the new pub

  • description: (string)

    description of the new pub

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  id: 102,
  slug: "my-doc-url",
  title: "Analysis of Spectral Filters",

  avatar: "https://assets.pubpub.org/_testing/1483555461063.jpg",

  hideAuthorsList: null,
  customAuthorList: null,
  distinguishedClone: null,
  inactive: null,
  isPublished: null,

  replyParentPubId: null,
  licenseId: null,

/pub/version

Routes to access data about a pub's versions

post

Create a new version. New files are added through this interface

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • pubId: required (number)

    id of the Pub this version will be attached to

  • versionMessage: required (string)

    message for this given version

  • isPublished: required (string)

    Boolean for whether this version should be published

  • files: (string)

    All files, those that are new should NOT include an "id" field and they will be added.

  • defaultFile: (string)

    Default file for this version

  • newFileAttribution: (string)

    Array of objects with {source: [file.name], destination: [file.name]}.

  • newFileRelations: (string)

    Array of objects with {fileName: [file.name], userId: [user's id]}.

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
    "id": 15,
}

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "Error creating pub"
}
put

Set values associated with the version.

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • pubId: required (number)

    id of the pub to be changed

  • versionId: required (number)

    id of the version to be changed

  • doi: (string)

    new DOI for a given version

  • defaultFile: (string)

    new defautlFile for a given version

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

true

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "Error updating pub"
}

Search

Routes to access PubPub search features

/search/all

get

Search for pubs, users, journals, and labels by string.

  • Request
  • Response

Query Parameters

  • q: required (string)

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  pubs: [],
  users: [],
  journals: [],
  labels: []
}

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

No Labels found

/search/journal

get

Search for journals by string. Journal title, url, and short description are indexed.

  • Request
  • Response

Query Parameters

  • q: required (string)

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

[
  {
  "id": 1,
  "title": "Journal of physics",
  "slug": "physics",
  "description": "This journal is about physics and other interesting things.",
  "logo": "http://www.image.com/example.jpg",
  "avatar": "http://www.image.com/avatar.jpg",
  }
]

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

No Journals found

/search/label

get

Search for labels by string. Label title is indexed.

  • Request
  • Response

Query Parameters

  • q: required (string)

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

[
  {
  "id": 1,
  "title": "Biology"
  }
]

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

No Labels found

get

  • Request
  • Response

Query Parameters

  • q: required (string)

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

[
  {
  "id": 1,
  "title": "Exciting new study!",
  "slug": "exciting",
  "description": "Here is my description",
  "avatar": "http://www.image.com/example.jpg",
  }
]

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

No Pubs found

  • Response

  "id": 1,

  "lastName": "LastName",

Body

SignUp

Used to trigger a signup request for a given email.

/signup

get

Gets the associated signup data for a given hash. Most importantly, returns the email that was signed up with.

  • Request
  • Response

Query Parameters

  • hash: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  hash: "hfwk18jJGTE81maj12K0kal9BY",
  email: "email@example.com"
}

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

Hash not valid
post

Creates a signup hash for a given email address. If the email has already been used (and account creation has not been completed), it will increment the count. On creation or increment, a signup email is sent.

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • email: required (string)

    email of the account to be created

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

true

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

Email already tied to an account

User

Routes to access data about Users

/user

get

Get the data for a user's profile. This includes associated pubs, forks, journals, etc. Private pubs, private data included if authenticated.

  • Request
  • Response

Query Parameters

  • username: required (string)

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  username: "jane"
  firstName: "Jane"
  lastName: "Sanchez"
  avatar: "https://avatars.com/1234"
  email: "jane@email.com (if authenticated)"
  bio: "I am a biologist."
  publicEmail: "jane@public.com"
  github: "https://github.com/jane"
  orcid: "123-412-1234-123"
  twitter: "@jane"
  website: "https://www.jane.com"
  googleScholar: "janejane",
  journals: [],
  pubs: [],
  followers: [],
  following: [],

}

HTTP status code 404

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "User not found"
}
post

Create a new User

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • email: required (string)

    email used in SignUp

  • hash: required (string)

    hash generated by SignUp. Used to validate account creation

  • username: required (string)

    username of the new User to be created

  • firstName: required (string)

    first name of the new User to be created

  • lastName: required (string)

    first name of the new User to be created

  • avatar: required (string)

    avatar for the new User to be created

  • password: required (string)

    a hash of the users typed password

  • bio: (string)

    bio for the new User to be created

  • publicEmail: (string)

    email that will be publicly displayed for the new User to be created

  • github: (string)

    github for the new User to be created

  • orcid: (string)

    orcid for the new User to be created

  • twitter: (string)

    twitter for the new User to be created

  • website: (string)

    website for the new User to be created

  • googleScholar: (string)

    googleScholar for the new User to be created

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  username: "jane"
  firstName: "Jane"
  lastName: "Sanchez"
  avatar: "https://avatars.com/1234"
  email: "jane@email.com"
  bio: "I am a biologist."
  publicEmail: "jane@public.com"
  github: "https://github.com/jane"
  orcid: "123-412-1234-123"
  twitter: "@jane"
  website: "https://www.jane.com"
  googleScholar: "janejane"
}

true

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "Error creating label"
}
delete

Delete the label relationship

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • labelId: (string)

    id of the label to be updated

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

Label deleted

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "Error deleting pub"
}

/user/password

Used to set a users password

post

Set a users password.

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • username: required (string)

    username of the account to login

  • password: required (string)

    password after hashing

  • resetHash: (string)

    The reset password hash you were granted by PubPub. If not logged in, must have a hash

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
}

HTTP status code 401

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

Unauthorized

get

  • Response

Query Parameters

  • resetHash: required (string)
  • username: required (string)

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

true

HTTP status code 401

Body

Type: application/json

Example:
